sen.j: 近衛 維子（このえ これこ、宝暦9年12月9日 (旧暦)（1760年12月6日） – 天明3年10月12日 (旧暦)（1783年11月6日））は、後桃園天皇の女御。
sen.e: Koreko KONOE (December 6, 1760 – November 6, 1783) was a nyogo of the Emperor Gomomozono.
Koreko KONOE (December 6, 1760 – November 6, 1783) was "Nyogo" (a wife or concubine of Emperor) of the Emperor Gomomozono.
sen.cmt: 女御の意味をカッコ内に追加しました。女御→http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%A5%B3%E5%BE%A1
sen.e: Koreko KONOE (December 6, 1760 – November 6, 1783) was "Nyogo" (a wife or concubine of Emperor) of the Emperor Gomomozono.

sen.j: 関白太政大臣近衛内前の娘。
sen.e: She was a daughter of the Kanpaku Dajodaijin (imperial regent and grand minister) Uchisaki KONOE.
She was a daughter of Kanpaku Dajodaijin (the imperial regent and grand minister) Uchisaki KONOE.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスです。Kanupaku Dajodaijinの前の"the"を削除し、imperial regent and grand ministerに追加しました。
sen.e: She was a daughter of Kanpaku Dajodaijin (the imperial regent and grand minister) Uchisaki KONOE.

sen.j: 弟に右大臣近衛経熙がいる。
sen.e: The Udaijin Tsunehiro KONOE was her younger brother.
Udaijin (the minister of the right), Tsunehiro KONOE was her younger brother.
sen.cmt: 文法ミスです。Udaijinの前置詞"the"を削除し、Udaijiの定訳を追加しました。
sen.e: Udaijin (the minister of the right), Tsunehiro KONOE was her younger brother.

sen.j: 明和5年（1769年）11月、皇太子英仁親王（のちの後桃園天皇）と結婚。
sen.e: In November 1769, she became a wife of the crown prince, Imperial Prince Hidehito (later the Emperor Gomomozono).
sen.cmt: "11月"は旧暦でのものか西暦でのものかここでは不明なのでそのまま11月としました。
sen.e: In November 1769, She got married to the crown prince who was Imperial Prince Hidehito (later the Emperor Gomomozono).
sen.cmt: 妻になったではなく、結婚したに訂正しました。
sen.e: In November 1769, She got married to the crown prince who was Imperial Prince Hidehito (later the Emperor Gomomozono).

sen.j: 明和7年（1770年）、英仁親王の即位に伴い、安永 (元号)元年（1772年）12月に女御宣下を受ける。
sen.e: In December 1772, she received an imperial letter of appointment as nyogo after the enthronement of Imperial Prince Hidehito in 1770.
sen.cmt: "12月"は旧暦でのものか西暦でのものかここでは不明なのでそのまま12月としました。
sen.e: In December 1772, She received an imperial letter of appointment as the title Nyogo, in consequence of that Imperial Prince Hidehito had been enthroned to the Emperor in 1770.
sen.cmt: 文章を自然な流れにするため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: In December 1772, She received an imperial letter of appointment as the title Nyogo, in consequence of that Imperial Prince Hidehito had been enthroned to the Emperor in 1770.

sen.j: 安永8年（1779年）1月に第一皇女・欣子内親王を出産し、同年6月には准三后に叙される。
sen.e: In January 1779, she gave birth to the first princess, Imperial Princess Yoshiko, followed by her promotion to Junsango in June.
sen.cmt: "1月"は旧暦でのものか西暦でのものかここでは不明なのでそのまま1月としました。
sen.e: In January 1779, she gave birth to the first daughter, Yoshiko; Imperial Princess Yoshiko was given the title "Jusango" (Sub-three empresses) in June of the same year.
sen.cmt: 単語を訂正しました。「准三后」の読み仮名訂正し、注釈を追加しました。http://kotobank.jp/word/%E5%87%86%E4%B8%89%E5%90%8E the first princess→the first daughter
sen.e: In January 1779, she gave birth to the first daughter, Yoshiko; Imperial Princess Yoshiko was given the title "Jusango" (Sub-three empresses) in June of the same year.

sen.j: しかし、同年11月に後桃園天皇が崩御。
sen.e: The Emperor Gomomozono passed away in November 1779.
sen.cmt: "11月"は旧暦でのものか西暦でのものかここでは不明なのでそのまま11月としました。
sen.e: The Emperor Gomomozono passed away in November 1779.
The Emperor Gomomozono passed away in November 1779.

sen.j: 天皇には欣子内親王以外に子女がなかったため、急遽傍系の閑院宮閑院宮典仁親王の第六王子・祐宮（のちの光格天皇）を維子の養子とし、皇位を継承させることとなった。
sen.e: Since Imperial Princess Yoshiko was the only child of the Emperor Gomomozono, Koreko hastily adopted Prince Sachinomiya (later the Emperor Kokaku) from a collateral line, the sixth prince of Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito, and then he ascended the throne.

Since Imperial Princess Yoshiko was the only child of the Emperor Gomomozono, Koreko had to hastily adopt Prince Sachinomiya from a collateral line; Prince Sachinomiya who was the sixth son of Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito ascended the throne as the Emperor Kokaku later.
sen.cmt: sixth prince→sixth sonに訂正。自然な文章にするため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: Since Imperial Princess Yoshiko was the only child of the Emperor Gomomozono, Koreko had to hastily adopt Prince Sachinomiya from a collateral line; Prince Sachinomiya who was the sixth son of Imperial Prince Kaninnomiya Sukehito ascended the throne as the Emperor Kokaku later.

sen.j: 安永10年（1781年）3月、皇太后となり、名実ともに嫡母として新帝を補佐する立場に置かれるが、それから間もなく、天明3年10月12日（1783年11月6日）に崩御。
sen.e: Although she became the Empress Dowager in March 1781 and entered the position to support the new emperor both in name and reality, shortly after that, Koreko passed away on November 6, 1783.

Koreko became the Empress Dowager in March 1781 and assumed the position to support the new emperor, which gave her both the title and power; Nevertheless, shortly after that, she passed away on November 6, 1783.
sen.cmt: 自然な文章にするため、全体的に訂正しました。
sen.e: Koreko became the Empress Dowager in March 1781 and assumed the position to support the new emperor, which gave her both the title and power; Nevertheless, shortly after that, she passed away on November 6, 1783.
She was 24 years old.
She died at the age of 24.
She died at the age of 24.

sen.j: 同日、女院号を宣下され、盛化門院（せいかもんいん）と称される。
sen.e: On the same day, she was given the Nyoingo, or the honorific name, "Seikamonin".
On the same day, she was given the title Nyoingo and was called "Seikamonin"as her honorific name.
sen.cmt: 自然な文章にするため、全体的に訂正しました。Nyogoにthe titleを追加。Was called …for herを追加しました。
sen.e: On the same day, she was given the title Nyoingo and was called "Seikamonin"as her honorific name.

sen.j: 陵墓は京都府京都市東山区の月輪陵。
sen.e: She lies at rest at the Tsukinowa Mausoleum in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
She lies at rest at the Tsukinowa Mausoleum in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
She lies at rest at the Tsukinowa Mausoleum in Higashiyama Ward, Kyoto City, Kyoto Prefecture.
